crypto.name: Drag away the crib
crypto.desc: Assume Unicode xor is used instead of ASCII xor

crypto.name: z3r000
crypto.desc: I studied that using padding saves me from small e problem, hence I did the same. Can you prove me wrong?

pwn.name: Cache 7
pwn.desc:
Data Structures - annoying and cumbersome yet a magic wand to swirl up solutions of the most herculean problems. Looks like something is messed up with a DS but Kathleen cannot figure it out how it is controlling her naive ARC assembly code. Can you show her how?

PS: The challenge uses the good old Ubuntu 18.04 libc ;)

rev.name: MargaREt
rev.desc: I was the first programmer to join and the first woman they hired. Male engineers were already working on the project, but they were hardware engineers and it wasn’t their thing. I had it as my background. I think [the lab] just figured that I could handle the unknown.

web.name: Superfund
web.desc: We're trying to educate the world about environmental justice and built a new site, but our admin followed a link sent by a hacker, and then the hacker got access to sensitive admin functionality. Can you figure out how they did it so we can stop it from happening again? Our developers tried and couldn't figure it out, but they did leave some comments in the source along the way. You can submit links to our admin here. The source code for the site is available as well.
